page.title: 09THE CITADEL
page.content: The Citadel is run by a group of people, some of whom are paid workers while others are volunteers. The building which used to be an old fort, is down by Leith Docks. The club activities include art, typing and playing board games. Over 100 children attend on a Tuesday evening. It is 10p for admission. The club starts at 5p.m. and finishes at 7p.m.There is a blackboard wall. There is a rest room and a very reasonable tuck shop. The leaders sometimes organise excursions for the children. They also hold roller discos and dances. The building is used on other days for meetings of various age groups: teenagers, mothers and toddlers, and elderly people.
